pageContext.claim: “I'm sorry, darling, the wind, the wind isn't blowing tonight. We can't watch television. … The wind is not blowing tonight and the government came and turned off all the windmills because they're killing all our bald eagles and all our birds.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often imagines that if there is no wind, then homes lose electricity. That's ridiculous. Wind turbines do not generate power when there's no wind, but the power grid can handle this variability.
